resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation:
Associates a challenge to an assessment by creating a AssessmentChallengeItem record. If
        the challenge already exists for the assessment, a 409 will be returned. If a global challenge
        is passed, a copy of it will be created for the given team and that copy will be used
        instead.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to update an item on

parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge you wish to associated to the assessment

resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation:
Allows you to modify the position and disabled languages of the AssessmentChallengeItem record. When changing the position, all other items in the
        list will be adjusted to account for the item's new position. If you wish to replace the challenge, you should
        first delete the AssessmentChallengeItem that you wish to replace, then create a new one.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to update an item on

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID (not the challenge ID)

parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: 1 based index that determines the order of the challenge sequence for the assessment.

parameters.name: data.disabled_languages
parameters.description: An array of language identifiers (aka ["csharp", "ruby"]) which indicate which languages should not be allowed for the challenge

resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation: Removes the AssessmentChallengeItem item from the assessment, causing the challenge to be disassociated.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to remove an item from

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID (not the challenge ID)

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing and creating assessment cohorts. Assessment cohorts are groups of candidates who get invited in bulk to a same assessment at one time.
explanation: Create an assessment cohort and invite all candidates included.

parameters.markdown: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.
parameters.name: data.candidates
parameters.description: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.
parameters.name: data.assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.

parameters.markdown: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.
parameters.name: data.assigned_team_member_ids
parameters.description: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.

parameters.markdown: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.

parameters.markdown: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.
parameters.name: data.expires_at
parameters.description: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.

parameters.markdown: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.
parameters.name: data.reminder_at
parameters.description: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.

parameters.markdown: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate. Only relevant if send_email_to_candidate is true.
parameters.name: data.custom_message
parameters.description: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate. Only relevant if send_email_to_candidate is true.

parameters.markdown: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own. If false is not explicitly passed, then the email will be sent by default.
parameters.name: data.send_email_to_candidate
parameters.description: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own. If false is not explicitly passed, then the email will be sent by default.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to send a copy of the invitation email to the inviting user's email address. This only has an affect on new invitations, if the invitation was already previously sent then this value will be ignored.
parameters.name: data.send_email_to_inviter
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to send a copy of the invitation email to the inviting user's email address. This only has an affect on new invitations, if the invitation was already previously sent then this value will be ignored.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to skip resending the email if the candidate is already invited. This can be useful if you are not sure if the invite has been sent yet and only want to send the email if one wasn't already sent. This value is ignored if send_email_to_candidate is explicitly set to false.
parameters.name: data.skip_email_resend
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to skip resending the email if the candidate is already invited. This can be useful if you are not sure if the invite has been sent yet and only want to send the email if one wasn't already sent. This value is ignored if send_email_to_candidate is explicitly set to false.

parameters.markdown: True if the first and last name should not be collected from new candidates. Otherwise new candidates will be asked to enter these details before starting the assessment.
parameters.name: data.skip_registration
parameters.description: True if the first and last name should not be collected from new candidates. Otherwise new candidates will be asked to enter these details before starting the assessment.

parameters.markdown: DEPRECATED: True if retry_action should be set to "reopen". Use retry_action property instead.
parameters.name: data.reopen_submitted
parameters.description: DEPRECATED: True if `retry_action` should be set to "reopen". Use `retry_action` property instead.

parameters.markdown: False if you wish to prevent active time from being tracked. This is only relevant if retry_action is "reopen". You can use this value when you want to allow a candidate to reopen their assessment result for the purpose of review.
parameters.name: data.track_active_time
parameters.description: False if you wish to prevent active time from being tracked. This is only relevant if `retry_action` is "reopen". You can use this value when you want to allow a candidate to reopen their assessment result for the purpose of review.

enum.reopen: Reopens the assessment result when the candidate visits the assessment. The candidate will be able to resume where they left off.
enum.retake: The candidate will be asked to start a new assessment, without carrying any previous work over. The original assessment result data will be kept as a separate record, and the new retake will be the featured result within the Qualified team UI.

parameters.markdown: The type of action that should be performed if the candidate has already submitted and you would like them to take further action. A null or omitted value indicates no retry action will be performed.
parameters.name: data.retry_action
parameters.description: The type of action that should be performed if the candidate has already submitted and you would like them to take further action. A null or omitted value indicates no retry action will be performed.

parameters.markdown: The date and time that the candidate can start the assessment. Useful if you want to invite one or more candidates and ensure that they all have a the same start time. When using with expires_at, this value should be sooner than expires_at. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake start window.
parameters.name: data.access_starts_at
parameters.description: The date and time that the candidate can start the assessment. Useful if you want to invite one or more candidates and ensure that they all have a the same start time. When using with expires_at, this value should be sooner than `expires_at`. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake start window.

parameters.markdown: The date and time in which the candidate will no longer have access to the assessment. Useful if you want to set a hard stop date in which no more candidate activity is allowed. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake stop window. The value must be at least one hour into the future.
parameters.name: data.access_ends_at
parameters.description: The date and time in which the candidate will no longer have access to the assessment. Useful if you want to set a hard stop date in which no more candidate activity is allowed. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake stop window. The value must be at least one hour into the future.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is manually unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start. If true, access will be locked even if within the access window defined by access_starts_at and access_ends_at.
parameters.name: data.access_locked
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is manually unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start. If true, access will be locked even if within the access window defined by `access_starts_at` and `access_ends_at`.

parameters.markdown: True if any challenge based timers should be reset. Timers will start over again from 0 when the candidate revisits each solution.
parameters.name: data.reset_challenge_timers
parameters.description: True if any challenge based timers should be reset. Timers will start over again from 0 when the candidate revisits each solution.

parameters.markdown: Set to number of minutes you wish to enforce as a time limit. If not set, will use the time limit set on the assessment. This value is only relevant if the candidate has not yet been invited, or if retry_action is set.
parameters.name: data.enforced_time_limit
parameters.description: Set to number of minutes you wish to enforce as a time limit. If not set, will use the time limit set on the assessment. This value is only relevant if the candidate has not yet been invited, or if `retry_action` is set.

parameters.markdown: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.
parameters.name: data.apply_day_defaults
parameters.description: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.

parameters.markdown: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.first_name
parameters.description: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

parameters.markdown: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.last_name
parameters.description: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

response_fields.markdown: Contains emails which have been successfully invited.
response_fields.name: invitedEmails
response_fields.description: Contains emails which have been successfully invited.

response_fields.markdown: Contains emails which have yet to be invited.
response_fields.name: pendingEmails
response_fields.description: Contains emails which have yet to be invited.

response_fields.markdown: Contains emails which failed to be invited successfully
response_fields.name: rejectedEmails
response_fields.description: Contains emails which failed to be invited successfully

response_fields.name: state
response_fields.description: The state of the assessment cohort

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing and creating invitations. Invitations are how candidates get explicitly introduced into the system. For private assessments, this is the only way to gain access to take the assessment.
explanation: The way to create a candidate within the system is to invite them to an assessment.

parameters.markdown: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.
parameters.name: data.candidates
parameters.description: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.
parameters.name: data.assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.

parameters.markdown: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.
parameters.name: data.assigned_team_member_ids
parameters.description: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.

parameters.markdown: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.

parameters.markdown: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.
parameters.name: data.expires_at
parameters.description: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.

parameters.markdown: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.
parameters.name: data.reminder_at
parameters.description: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.

parameters.markdown: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate. Only relevant if send_email_to_candidate is true.
parameters.name: data.custom_message
parameters.description: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate. Only relevant if send_email_to_candidate is true.

parameters.markdown: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own. If false is not explicitly passed, then the email will be sent by default.
parameters.name: data.send_email_to_candidate
parameters.description: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own. If false is not explicitly passed, then the email will be sent by default.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to send a copy of the invitation email to the inviting user's email address. This only has an affect on new invitations, if the invitation was already previously sent then this value will be ignored.
parameters.name: data.send_email_to_inviter
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to send a copy of the invitation email to the inviting user's email address. This only has an affect on new invitations, if the invitation was already previously sent then this value will be ignored.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to skip resending the email if the candidate is already invited. This can be useful if you are not sure if the invite has been sent yet and only want to send the email if one wasn't already sent. This value is ignored if send_email_to_candidate is explicitly set to false.
parameters.name: data.skip_email_resend
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to skip resending the email if the candidate is already invited. This can be useful if you are not sure if the invite has been sent yet and only want to send the email if one wasn't already sent. This value is ignored if send_email_to_candidate is explicitly set to false.

parameters.markdown: True if the first and last name should not be collected from new candidates. Otherwise new candidates will be asked to enter these details before starting the assessment.
parameters.name: data.skip_registration
parameters.description: True if the first and last name should not be collected from new candidates. Otherwise new candidates will be asked to enter these details before starting the assessment.

parameters.markdown: DEPRECATED: True if retry_action should be set to "reopen". Use retry_action property instead.
parameters.name: data.reopen_submitted
parameters.description: DEPRECATED: True if `retry_action` should be set to "reopen". Use `retry_action` property instead.

parameters.markdown: False if you wish to prevent active time from being tracked. This is only relevant if retry_action is "reopen". You can use this value when you want to allow a candidate to reopen their assessment result for the purpose of review.
parameters.name: data.track_active_time
parameters.description: False if you wish to prevent active time from being tracked. This is only relevant if `retry_action` is "reopen". You can use this value when you want to allow a candidate to reopen their assessment result for the purpose of review.

enum.reopen: Reopens the assessment result when the candidate visits the assessment. The candidate will be able to resume where they left off.
enum.retake: The candidate will be asked to start a new assessment, without carrying any previous work over. The original assessment result data will be kept as a separate record, and the new retake will be the featured result within the Qualified team UI.

parameters.markdown: The type of action that should be performed if the candidate has already submitted and you would like them to take further action. A null or omitted value indicates no retry action will be performed.
parameters.name: data.retry_action
parameters.description: The type of action that should be performed if the candidate has already submitted and you would like them to take further action. A null or omitted value indicates no retry action will be performed.

parameters.markdown: The date and time that the candidate can start the assessment. Useful if you want to invite one or more candidates and ensure that they all have a the same start time. When using with expires_at, this value should be sooner than expires_at. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake start window.
parameters.name: data.access_starts_at
parameters.description: The date and time that the candidate can start the assessment. Useful if you want to invite one or more candidates and ensure that they all have a the same start time. When using with expires_at, this value should be sooner than `expires_at`. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake start window.

parameters.markdown: The date and time in which the candidate will no longer have access to the assessment. Useful if you want to set a hard stop date in which no more candidate activity is allowed. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake stop window. The value must be at least one hour into the future.
parameters.name: data.access_ends_at
parameters.description: The date and time in which the candidate will no longer have access to the assessment. Useful if you want to set a hard stop date in which no more candidate activity is allowed. When using with retakes, this value can be used to set the retake stop window. The value must be at least one hour into the future.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is manually unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start. If true, access will be locked even if within the access window defined by access_starts_at and access_ends_at.
parameters.name: data.access_locked
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is manually unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start. If true, access will be locked even if within the access window defined by `access_starts_at` and `access_ends_at`.

parameters.markdown: True if any challenge based timers should be reset. Timers will start over again from 0 when the candidate revisits each solution.
parameters.name: data.reset_challenge_timers
parameters.description: True if any challenge based timers should be reset. Timers will start over again from 0 when the candidate revisits each solution.

parameters.markdown: Set to number of minutes you wish to enforce as a time limit. If not set, will use the time limit set on the assessment. This value is only relevant if the candidate has not yet been invited, or if retry_action is set.
parameters.name: data.enforced_time_limit
parameters.description: Set to number of minutes you wish to enforce as a time limit. If not set, will use the time limit set on the assessment. This value is only relevant if the candidate has not yet been invited, or if `retry_action` is set.

parameters.markdown: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.
parameters.name: data.apply_day_defaults
parameters.description: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.

parameters.markdown: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.first_name
parameters.description: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

parameters.markdown: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.last_name
parameters.description: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

parameters.markdown: Used for teams to track their own IDs alongside candidates.
parameters.name: data.alternate_id
parameters.description: Used for teams to track their own IDs alongside candidates.

response_fields.markdown: Will be true if the person being assessed is a team member
response_fields.name: testTeamMember
response_fields.description: Will be true if the person being assessed is a team member

response_fields.markdown: The number of times the invitation email has been sent.
response_fields.name: sendAttempts
response_fields.description: The number of times the invitation email has been sent.

response_fields.markdown: The number of times the invitation email has been opened. Will not always be accurate, as some email clients may be configured to prevent this.
response_fields.name: openCount
response_fields.description: The number of times the invitation email has been opened. Will not always be accurate, as some email clients may be configured to prevent this.

response_fields.markdown: The date that the last invitation email was sent.
response_fields.name: lastSent
response_fields.description: The date that the last invitation email was sent.

response_fields.markdown: The URL path that the candidate can use to start the assessment. You can use this value yourself if you wish to control how candidates get sent to your assessments. You may want to consider disabling the email invitation when utilizing this value.
response_fields.name: invitePath
response_fields.description: The URL path that the candidate can use to start the assessment. You can use this value yourself if you wish to control how candidates get sent to your assessments. You may want to consider disabling the email invitation when utilizing this value.

response_fields.markdown: The URL path that a candidate can use to take a practice assessment, which is simply so that they can get familiar with the platform.
response_fields.name: invitePracticePath
response_fields.description: The URL path that a candidate can use to take a practice assessment, which is simply so that they can get familiar with the platform.

response_fields.markdown: Will be true if a reminder email has been sent.
response_fields.name: reminded
response_fields.description: Will be true if a reminder email has been sent.

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing and creating invitations. Invitations are how candidates get explicitly introduced into the system. For private assessments, this is the only way to gain access to take the assessment.
explanation: Allows you to invite a team member to a specific assessment. This will cause team members to receive an email. This API is useful for when you want to have members of your team test the assessment, before sending it out to candidates. You will not be charged a usage for having your own team members take the assessment.

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing and creating invitations. Invitations are how candidates get explicitly introduced into the system. For private assessments, this is the only way to gain access to take the assessment.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to restrict results to.

parameters.name: team_candidate_id

response_fields.markdown: The total time between when the assessment entered the started state and when it entered a submission state. This is the wall time and does not take into account any of Qualified's active time tracking.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Retrieves an assessment result by ID. Note that this endpoint returns a large amount of data that is typically consumed by Qualified application itself. Some fields may change. It is recommended to use the "Exhibit" endpoint where possible.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result

response_fields.markdown: True if the assessment result is locked from allowing the candidate to start.
response_fields.name: accessLocked
response_fields.description: True if the assessment result is locked from allowing the candidate to start.

response_fields.markdown: The date that the assessment result was last unlocked. Will be null if never locked.
response_fields.name: accessUnlockedAt
response_fields.description: The date that the assessment result was last unlocked. Will be null if never locked.

response_fields.markdown: The date of the last heartbeat received, which is how active time is tracked.
response_fields.name: lastHeartbeat
response_fields.description: The date of the last heartbeat received, which is how active time is tracked.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the reason why the assessment result was closed.
response_fields.name: closedReason
response_fields.description: Indicates the reason why the assessment result was closed.

response_fields.markdown: The state of the assessment result.
response_fields.name: state
response_fields.description: The state of the assessment result.

response_fields.markdown: The overall score of the assessment result, which is the average of all challenge scores.
response_fields.name: score
response_fields.description: The overall score of the assessment result, which is the average of all challenge scores.

response_fields.markdown: Any feedback the candidate has left, which are captured on the final assessment screen before submitting.
response_fields.name: candidateRemarks
response_fields.description: Any feedback the candidate has left, which are captured on the final assessment screen before submitting.

response_fields.markdown: The number of seconds that the candidate was considered active on the assessment. This takes into accounts things such as lack of activity on the page, or the page being moved to the background or closed.
response_fields.name: accumulatedSeconds
response_fields.description: The number of seconds that the candidate was considered active on the assessment. This takes into accounts things such as lack of activity on the page, or the page being moved to the background or closed.

response_fields.markdown: The total time between when the assessment entered the started state and when it entered a submission state. This is the wall time and does not take into account any of Qualified's active time tracking.
response_fields.name: totalSubmissionSeconds
response_fields.description: The total time between when the assessment entered the started state and when it entered a submission state. This is the wall time and does not take into account any of Qualified's active time tracking.

response_fields.markdown: Similar to total_submission_seconds, however if the assessment was reopened at any point, this value will indicate the original submission seconds and exclude any time relevant to the reopen.
response_fields.name: totalOriginalSubmissionSeconds
response_fields.description: Similar to total_submission_seconds, however if the assessment was reopened at any point, this value will indicate the original submission seconds and exclude any time relevant to the reopen.

response_fields.markdown: If this assessment is a retake, the number will be greater than 1. Multiple retakes are possible, each assessment result is related to a specific take.
response_fields.name: retakeNumber
response_fields.description: If this assessment is a retake, the number will be greater than 1. Multiple retakes are possible, each assessment result is related to a specific take.

response_fields.markdown: True if the score is at or above the minimum passing score (cut score) associated with the assessment. Note that this does not take into account challenge passing scores, only the passing_score value set on the assessment itself.
response_fields.name: passingScore
response_fields.description: True if the score is at or above the minimum passing score (cut score) associated with the assessment. Note that this does not take into account challenge passing scores, only the passing_score value set on the assessment itself.

labels.desc: Any labels which are associated with the assessment.

passing_score.desc: Indicates the minimum passing score (cut score) configured for the assessment.

pass_rate.desc: Indicates the percentage of submissions that have passed.

submission_rate.desc: Indicates the percentage of assessments that have been submitted.

counts.desc: Tracks number of results within different states, as well as total count.

key_stats.desc: An object representing fields as keys, and objects as values which contain median, mean, std_dev and count values for each value.

response_fields.markdown: Information about the related assessment.
response_fields.name: assessment
response_fields.description: Information about the related assessment.

schema.language: Indicates the programming language this challenge was solved in, if applicable.
schema.candidate_notes: Any feedback left by the candidate within the notes tab of the solution.

similarity_risk_level.desc: Indicates the level of risk that this solution is too similar to others that have been previously submitted. Will be null if there is no risk.

items_correct_count.desc: Indicates the number of questions or test cases that were correct.

items_total_count.desc: Indicates the total number of questions or test cases.

score.desc: Indicates the score of the solution.

passed.desc: Indicates if the solution met the minimum passing score threshold of the challenge to be considered passing.

ccn.desc: Cyclomatic code complexity. Only provided if the solution is one of the code challenge types.

submitted_in.desc: Time in seconds from when the solution was started to when it was submitted, in some cases, this data is inferred from various data fields due to how submissions are tracked for older formats.

completed_in.desc: Time in seconds from when the solution was started and to when it was fully completed.

challenge.desc: Information about the challenge this solution is related to.

schema.title: Title of the challenge.
schema.summary: Challenge summary, which is also shown to candidates before starting.
schema.purpose: Internal note about the purpose of the challenge and the goals it is meant to achieve.

passing_score.desc: A 0 - 100 value indicating the minimum score (cut score) that is needed to be considered passing.

submitted_solutions_count.desc: The number of solutions which have been submitted for this challenge.

difficulty.desc: Indicates a general level of difficulty for the challenge. Lower the number the easier.

submission_rate.desc: The rate in which solutions that are started are submitted.

pass_rate.desc: The percentage of viable solutions which are passing.

web_preview_enabled.desc: Indicates if this challenge has web preview enabled, which can be used to determine if there is a UI aspect to the challenge.

key_stats.desc: Information related to stats for the challenge. These can be used in conjunction with solution values to indicate a general performance benchmark.

accumulated_seconds.desc: Stats related to the number of active seconds spent on solution, regardless of them passing or not.

passed_accumulated_seconds.desc: Stats related to the number of active seconds spent on passing solution.

revisions.desc: Indicates number of solution revisions. This gives a general indication of amount of effort, as more revisions indicate more code edits while working on the solution.

mass.desc: Indicates the size of the solution, using an algorithm designed by Qualified that is similar to lines of code. Instead of counting lines, it counts variables, expressions, key words and other tokens within the code.

ccn.desc: Stats related to code cyclomatic complexity.

response_fields.markdown: Array of solutions representing information about each challenge solved.
response_fields.name: solutions
response_fields.description: Array of solutions representing information about each challenge solved.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Returns a set of sharable URLs which do not require login, **only available if feature is enabled on your subscription**.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to share

enum.pageStyling: Removes print-like page styling (ignored for PDF reports)
enum.candidateAnonymousName: Candidate's Anonymous Name (when combined with candidateName)

parameters.name: hide

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Unlocks an access_locked assessment result so a candidate can begin their assessment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to unlock

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Closes without submitting the assessment result. This prevents the candidate from continuing, and also doesn't generate a score, call webhooks, or trigger automated workflows. This can be useful for orchestrating your own expiration functionality where you do not want to submit any pre-existing progress for scoring.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to terminate

parameters.name: data.closed_reason
parameters.description: Indicates the reason for closing the assessment result without submitting it.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Schedules a reopen or retake for a submitted assessment result so that the candidate can make changes. This endpoint is only valid on assessment results which are current. If a retake has happened since this assessment result was submitted, then it cannot be reopened. This endpoint used to be called "Unsubmit" and is backwards compatible.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to reopen.  The assessment result must be current, which means a retake has not happened since it was submitted.

parameters.name: data.enforced_time_limit
parameters.description: Reset the time limit to the specified number of minutes.

parameters.name: data.send_email_to_candidate
parameters.description: True if you wish to send a new invitation email.

parameters.name: data.custom_message
parameters.description: Customize the message to be sent, only relevant if send_email_to_candidate is true.

parameters.name: data.retry_action
parameters.description: Set to "retake" if you want to have the candidate to start the assessment over from scratch.

parameters.name: data.reset_challenge_timers
parameters.description: True if you wish to reset all challenge timers, which will cause any timers to start with their original settings. For Q&A challenges, question timers will be reset as well.

parameters.name: data.access_starts_at
parameters.description: The date for when the candidate should be allowed to reopen. Defaults to current time if not provided.

parameters.name: data.access_ends_at
parameters.description: The date up to when the candidate is allowed to reopen. If not set there will be no limit.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: An assessment result can be scheduled to be reopened or retaken, which happens once the candidate lands on the assessment page. Calling this method will cancel a previously scheduled retry. To schedule a retry, use the invitations invite_candidates endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to cancel.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Reopens an assessment result, and updates the challenges to the latest published version of the assessment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to reset.

parameters.name: data.reset_all
parameters.description: If true, completely remove all solutions and start from scratch. Otherwise, only update the assessment result and challenges list.\n\n**NOTE:** If set to true, all solutions will be removed. This is not reversible, solutions will be lost forever.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Enables completely destroying an assessment result that has not been started. NOTE: AssessmentResult state MUST be "invited" or "opened" to be destroyed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to delete.

resource_explanation: Assessment templates are pre-built assessments which you can use as-is or as a starting point to build your own.
explanation: Returns a paged list of assessment templates.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Returns assessment for both authenticated and unauthenticated users. Only admins and team members can see unpublished assessments.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to retrieve.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Creates a new assessment in a draft state. If you wish to create an assessment within a published state, you should first create the assessment, use the Assessment Challenge Items API to add challenges, then call the Assessment publish endpoint.

parameters.markdown: What this assessment will be titled as.
parameters.name: data.title
parameters.description: What this assessment will be titled as.

parameters.markdown: Used to display a short summary to candidates about the assessment.
parameters.name: data.summary
parameters.description: Used to display a short summary to candidates about the assessment.

parameters.markdown: Internal value useful for explaining to team members why what this assessment is focused on.
parameters.name: data.purpose
parameters.description: Internal value useful for explaining to team members why what this assessment is focused on.

parameters.markdown: An array of label strings to assign to the assessment. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of label strings to assign to the assessment. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Publishes a draft assessment. There must be at least one challenge item associated, and all challenges must already be published.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Moves an assessment back to the draft state, preventing new invitations from being able to be sent for this assessment. Existing invitations will remain active.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Archives the assessment. Any active invitations will be cancelled, and any started assessment results will be closed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Unarchives the assessment

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Makes a copy of an assessment on the team provided. The user must have access to both teams to export the assessment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to export.

parameters.name: data.export_to
parameters.description: ID of the team the assessment should be exported to.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Unlocks any access_locked assessment results associated with this assessment. Note the results are unlocked asynchronously.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to unlock assessment results for.

resource_explanation: General endpoints for working with various types of challenges. The $type parameter will often be warranted as it will allow you to specify the type of challenge that should be handled.
explanation: Returns all Qualified and team challenges. You can limit results by type or collection to refine the results.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: if provided will filter by either `"team"` or `"global"` (qualified) challenges.

parameters.name: templates
parameters.description: If set to true, will return only templates. By default everything but templates are returned.

parameters.name: $type
parameters.description: The type of challenge to filter by.

explanation: Creates a quiz question for a QuizChallenge. $type must be provided to specify the type of question being created. $type cannot be changed once the record is created.

parameters.markdown: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.
parameters.name: data.prompt
parameters.description: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.

parameters.markdown: The model type of the question.
parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The model type of the question.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.
parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.

parameters.markdown: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.
parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.

parameters.markdown: The weight to assign to this question. The default is 1.
parameters.name: data.weight
parameters.description: The weight to assign to this question. The default is `1`.

parameters.markdown: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.
parameters.name: data.all_or_nothing
parameters.description: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.

id.desc: The ID of the choice. When making updates, you will want to preserve this value so that previous existing answers can be properly reported on.

label.desc: The text of the choice. Markdown is supported.

value.desc: The value/weight of the choice. Use 0 if the choice is not correct. Negative values are also supported, which can be used to take away points from other correct choices selected.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.
parameters.name: data.choices
parameters.description: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.

parameters.markdown: The total number of choices a candidate can select.
parameters.name: data.max_selections
parameters.description: The total number of choices a candidate can select.

parameters.markdown: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.
parameters.name: data.max_sum
parameters.description: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.

parameters.markdown: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.
parameters.name: data.weighted_scoring
parameters.description: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.

parameters.markdown: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.
parameters.name: data.min_characters
parameters.description: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.

parameters.markdown: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.
parameters.name: data.max_characters
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.

parameters.markdown: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.
parameters.name: data.default_value
parameters.description: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.

case.desc: True if case sensitivity should be used.

multi.desc: True if multiline regex flag should be used.

negate.desc: True if the the answer SHOULD'T match.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.
parameters.name: data.matches
parameters.description: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.
